intro: Stroganowia intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate stroganowia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant features upright, herbaceous stems with alternate, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, greenish-white flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom during the rainy season. Stroganowia intermedia is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and wetlands.
